sectionText: This course is about the technical and moral complexities of trying to use new communication technologies for altruistic ends. We will examine various forms of "digital humanitarianism" that use new media in support of disaster relief, human rights monitoring, environmental activism, and other causes. Course projects will involve hands-on experience with new media resources such as collaboration platforms and crowdsourcing techniques. Those taking the course for graduate credit will read and extend mediatization theory.
